page.title: 10PLACE NAMES.
page.content: {Salesbury. First listed in 1246,linked with {Salewheel, a wide,deep pool in the Ribble.The elements of Sale Wheel are willows and whirlpool,both still to be seen. {Clayton-le-Dale.} 1246-"the farm on clayey soil". {Lovely (-ley). Lovelay in 1450. "The lea of Lufa". {Copster Green. Copthurst in 1291.A small wooded hill. {Ribchester. The camp on the Ribble.In Roman times {Bremetennacum.} {Ramsgreave. Formerly Romsgrove,the hilly grazing for the rams to separate them from the ewes and lambs. {Showley (Hall and Fold). On sloping ground,oblique,wry.The{Hall is North of the Ribble,the{Fold}South.
